meanings.definition: Resembling a spider in appearance or movement.
meanings.sent1: The spidery shadows danced on the wall as the branches swayed outside.
meanings.sent2: The Halloween decorations included spidery webs and fake spiders.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her spidery handwriting looked like a spider had crawled across the page.
meanings.sent4: The spidery cracks in the old painting seemed to form a hidden message.
meanings.sent5: The spidery legs of the insect left intricate patterns in the sand.

meanings.definition: Characterized by long, thin lines or legs.
meanings.sent1: The spidery branches of the tree reached out towards the sky.
meanings.sent2: The spidery cracks in the sidewalk seemed to stretch endlessly.
meanings.sent3: The spidery lines of the drawing gave it a sense of elegance.
meanings.sent4: Her spidery necklace cascaded down her neck like delicate threads.
meanings.sent5: The spidery shadows of the fence created a mesmerizing pattern on the ground.

meanings.definition: Having a delicate or intricate quality.
meanings.sent1: The spidery lace on her dress added a touch of elegance to her outfit.
meanings.sent2: The spidery design on the vase was so detailed, it looked almost real.
meanings.sent3: The spidery pattern on the cake made it too beautiful to eat.
meanings.sent4: Her spidery jewelry sparkled in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.
meanings.sent5: The spidery embroidery on the pillow was a testament to the artist's skill.
